Pre-Game Insights: Milwaukee Brewers host the New York Mets in the first of a three-game series.
Milwaukee Brewers have a 91-68 overall record and a strong home performance.
New York Mets are in second place in the NL East with an 87-70 record.
Key players include Willy Adames and William Contreras for the Brewers, and Francisco Lindor and Jose Iglesias for the Mets.
The Brewers have a strong on-base percentage, while the Mets excel when scoring five or more runs.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series is the fourth meeting between the two teams this season.
